precontext: Tom was eager to blend in at the comedy show. He settled into one of the middle rows of the theater, trying not to draw attention. The large venue was buzzing with anticipation as people took their seats.
sentence: The guy in the crowd appeared to be next to a plant.
ending: And not a very good one, because he was nervously reading his script.
meanings_considered: an actor situated in the audience whose acting is rehearsed but seems spontaneous to the audience
(botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion
explanation:
• The precontext describes a comedy show setting where audience members are present, making the meaning of "plant" as an actor in the audience highly plausible.  
• The phrase "next to a plant" in a crowd setting is more naturally interpreted as a person (actor) rather than a botanical entity, given the absence of any mention of gardening or plants in the environment.  
• The ending clarifies that the guy was nervously reading his script, which strongly supports the interpretation of "plant" as a performer, not a living organism.
clear_meaning_text: an actor situated in the audience whose acting is rehearsed but seems spontaneous to the audience
